wikipedia_page.main: Keith Frank Stock (born 18 March 1957) is a male retired British athlete. Stock competed in the men's pole vault at the 1984 Summer Olympics. He represented England in the pole vault event, at the 1982 Commonwealth Games in Brisbane, Queensland, Australia.

1981 European Athletics Indoor Championships – Men's pole vault

response: Fatima Whitbread won her fourth consecutive women's javelin throw UK title, while Aston Moore won his third straight men's triple jump title. Aside from Moore, four men successfully defended their 1983 titles and Peter Elliott (1500 metres), Keith Stock (pole vault), Derrick Brown (long jump) and Peter Yates (javelin). Venissa Head was the only woman to defend her title, doing so in the discus throw. Heather Oakes was the only athlete to win multiple UK titles, taking the women's 100 metres and 200 metres to repeat a feat she had achieved five years previously.
